intro: Ceraia inconcinna, commonly known as the slender ceraia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces umbels of tiny white flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
